title: ISC2 CISSP Practice Questions - Set 4 (Q151-200)
description: Final set of CISSP certification exam practice questions

questions.question: When designing a new Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) network, an organization's top concern is preventing unauthorized users accessing the VoIP network. Which of the following will BEST help secure the VoIP network?
options: Web application firewall (WAF)
Transport Layer Security (TLS)
questions.explanation: 802.1x is a network access control protocol that provides port-based network authentication, preventing unauthorized devices from accessing the VoIP network infrastructure.

questions.question: A user's credential for an application is stored in a relational database. Which control protects the confidentiality of the credential while it is stored?
options: Use a salted cryptographic hash of the password
Validate passwords using a stored procedure
Allow only the application to have access to the password field in order to verify user authentication
Encrypt the entire database and embed an encryption key in the application
questions.explanation: Using a salted cryptographic hash ensures passwords cannot be reversed to plaintext. Salting prevents rainbow table attacks, making it the best protection for stored credentials.

questions.question: Which of the following frameworks provides vulnerability metrics and characteristics to support the National Vulnerability Database (NVD)?
options: Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE)
Center for Internet Security (CIS)
Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS)
Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP)
questions.explanation: CVSS provides a standardized scoring system to assess vulnerability severity with metrics for impact, exploitability, and temporal factors, supporting the NVD with consistent vulnerability ratings.

questions.question: A security architect is reviewing plans for an application with a Recovery Point Objective (RPO) of 15 minutes. The current design has all of the application infrastructure located within one co-location data center. Which security principle is the architect currently assessing?
options: Disaster recovery (DR)
Availability
Redundancy
Business continuity (BC)
questions.explanation: The architect is assessing availability, as having all infrastructure in one location creates a single point of failure that could prevent meeting the 15-minute RPO requirement.

questions.question: Which factors MUST be considered when classifying information and supporting assets for risk management, legal discovery, and compliance?
options: System owner roles and responsibilities, data handling standards, storage and secure development lifecycle requirements
Compliance office roles and responsibilities, classified material handling standards, storage system lifecycle requirements
Data stewardship roles, data handling and storage standards, data lifecycle requirements
System authorization roles and responsibilities, cloud computing standards, lifecycle requirements
questions.explanation: Data classification requires consideration of data stewardship roles (who is responsible), handling and storage standards (how to protect it), and lifecycle requirements (retention and disposal).

questions.question: The Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) of a small organization is making a case for building a security operations center (SOC). While debating between an in-house, fully outsourced, or a hybrid capability, which of the following would be the MAIN consideration, regardless of the model?
options: Headcount and capacity
Scope and service catalog
Skill set and training
Tools and technologies
questions.explanation: Scope and service catalog define what the SOC will monitor and which services it will provide, which must be determined first before deciding on staffing, skills, or tools.

questions.question: An organization would like to ensure that all new users have a predefined departmental access template applied upon creation. The organization would also like additional access for users to be granted on a per-project basis. What type of user access administration is BEST suited to meet the organization's needs?
options: Decentralized
Hybrid
Centralized
Federated
questions.explanation: Hybrid access administration combines centralized control for standard departmental access with decentralized project-based access, providing both consistency and flexibility.

questions.question: Which of the following is a secure design principle for a new product?
options: Restrict the use of modularization
Do not rely on previously used code
Build in appropriate levels of fault tolerance
Utilize obfuscation whenever possible
questions.explanation: Fault tolerance is a key secure design principle that ensures systems can continue operating safely even when components fail, maintaining availability and security.

questions.question: What is the PRIMARY benefit of relying on Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP)?
options: Standardize specifications between software security products
Achieve organizational compliance with international standards
Improve vulnerability assessment capabilities
Save security costs for the organization
questions.explanation: SCAP's primary benefit is improving vulnerability assessment by providing standardized methods for expressing and measuring security vulnerabilities, configurations, and compliance.

questions.question: What are the three key benefits that application developers should derive from the northbound application programming interface (API) of software defined networking (SDN)?
options: Network syntax, abstraction of network flow, and abstraction of network protocols
Network syntax, abstraction of network commands, and abstraction of network protocols
Familiar syntax, abstraction of network topology, and definition of network protocols
Familiar syntax, abstraction of network topology, and abstraction of network protocols
questions.explanation: SDN northbound APIs provide developers with familiar programming syntax, abstract away complex network topology details, and hide low-level protocol implementations.

questions.question: Which of the following is a unique feature of attribute-based access control (ABAC)?
options: A user is granted access to a system at a particular time of day
A user is granted access to a system based on username and password
A user is granted access to a system based on group affinity
A user is granted access to a system with biometric authentication
questions.explanation: ABAC's unique feature is the ability to use contextual attributes like time of day, location, or device type in access decisions, providing dynamic, context-aware access control.

questions.question: Which of the following is the BEST approach to implement multiple servers on a virtual system?
options: Implement one primary function per virtual server and apply individual security configuration for each virtual server
Implement multiple functions within the same virtual server and apply individual security configurations to each function
Implement one primary function per virtual server and apply high security configuration on the host operating system
Implement multiple functions per virtual server and apply the same security configuration for each virtual server
questions.explanation: One function per virtual server with individual security configurations follows the principle of separation of duties and allows tailored security controls for each service.

questions.question: Which of the following is the MOST common cause of system or security failures?
options: Lack of physical security controls
Lack of change control
Lack of logging and monitoring
Lack of system documentation
questions.explanation: Lack of change control is the most common cause of failures as uncontrolled changes can introduce vulnerabilities, incompatibilities, and misconfigurations.

questions.question: The Chief Information Officer (CIO) has decided that as part of business modernization efforts the organization will move towards a cloud architecture. All business-critical data will be migrated to either internal or external cloud services within the next two years. The CIO has a PRIMARY obligation to work with personnel in which role in order to ensure proper protection of data during and after the cloud migration?
options: Chief Security Officer (CSO)
Information owner
Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)
General Counsel
questions.explanation: Information owners are responsible for the protection and classification of their data. The CIO must work with them to ensure data protection requirements are met during migration.

questions.question: A developer is creating an application that requires secure logging of all user activity. What is the BEST permission the developer should assign to the log file to ensure requirements are met?
options: Execute
Read
Write
Append
questions.explanation: Append-only permissions allow new log entries to be added while preventing modification or deletion of existing entries, ensuring log integrity for security and audit purposes.

questions.question: When performing an investigation with the potential for legal action, what should be the analyst's FIRST consideration?
options: Data decryption
Chain-of-custody
Authorization to collect
Court admissibility
questions.explanation: Chain-of-custody must be established from the beginning to ensure evidence integrity and admissibility. Without proper chain-of-custody, evidence may be inadmissible in court.

questions.question: Building blocks for software-defined networks (SDN) require which of the following?
options: The SDN is composed entirely of client-server pairs
Random-access memory (RAM) is used in preference to virtual memory
The SDN is mostly composed of virtual machines (VM)
Virtual memory is used in preference to random-access memory (RAM)
questions.explanation: SDN architectures rely heavily on virtualization, with network functions implemented as virtual machines to provide flexibility and programmability.

questions.question: What is the MINIMUM standard for testing a disaster recovery plan (DRP)?
options: Quarterly or more frequently depending upon the advice of the information security manager
As often as necessary depending upon the stability of the environment and business requirements
Annually or less frequently depending upon audit department requirements
Semi-annually and in alignment with a fiscal half-year business cycle
questions.explanation: DRP testing frequency should be based on environmental changes and business needs. More volatile environments require more frequent testing to ensure plan effectiveness.

questions.question: Which security audit standard provides the BEST way for an organization to understand a vendor's Information Systems (IS) in relation to confidentiality, integrity, and availability?
options: Service Organization Control (SOC) 2
Statement on Standards for Attestation Engagements (SSAE) 18
Statement on Auditing Standards (SAS) 70
Service Organization Control (SOC) 1
questions.explanation: SOC 2 specifically addresses security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy controls, making it ideal for assessing vendor IS security.

questions.question: An application team is running tests to ensure that user entry fields will not accept invalid input of any length. What type of negative testing is this an example of?
options: Allowed number of characters
Population of required fields
Reasonable data
Session testing
questions.explanation: Testing for reasonable data validates that input makes logical sense and is within acceptable parameters, preventing invalid or malicious data from being processed.

questions.question: An organization is considering partnering with a third-party supplier of cloud services. The organization will only be providing the data and the third-party supplier will be providing the security controls. Which of the following BEST describes this service offering?
options: Platform as a Service (PaaS)
Anything as a Service (XaaS)
Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS)
Software as a Service (SaaS)
questions.explanation: SaaS provides complete applications where the provider manages all infrastructure, platform, and security controls while the customer only provides and manages their data.

questions.question: Which of the following factors should be considered characteristics of Attribute Based Access Control (ABAC) in terms of the attributes used?
options: Mandatory Access Control (MAC) and Discretionary Access Control (DAC)
Discretionary Access Control (DAC) and Access Control List (ACL)
Role Based Access Control (RBAC) and Mandatory Access Control (MAC)
Role Based Access Control (RBAC) and Access Control List (ACL)
questions.explanation: ABAC can incorporate both RBAC attributes (roles) and ACL attributes (resource permissions) to make flexible, context-aware access control decisions.

questions.question: Which of the following is the MOST significant key management problem due to the number of keys created?
options: Exponential growth when using symmetric keys
Exponential growth when using asymmetric keys
Storage of the keys require increased security
Keys are more difficult to provision and revoke
questions.explanation: Symmetric key systems require n(n-1)/2 keys for n users to communicate securely, resulting in exponential growth and significant key management challenges.

questions.question: A Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) with identity and access management (IAM) responsibilities is asked by the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) to perform a vulnerability assessment on a web application to pass a Payment Card Industry (PCI) audit. The CISSP has never performed this before. According to the (ISC)² Code of Professional Ethics, which of the following should the CISSP do?
options: Inform the CISO that they are unable to perform the task because they should render only those services for which they are fully competent and qualified
Since they are CISSP certified, they have enough knowledge to assist with the request, but will need assistance in order to complete it in a timely manner
Review the CISSP guidelines for performing a vulnerability assessment before proceeding to complete it
Review the PCI requirements before performing the vulnerability assessment
questions.explanation: The (ISC)² Code of Ethics requires professionals to be competent and qualified for the services they provide. The CISSP should inform the CISO of their limitations.

questions.question: While performing a security review for a new product, an information security professional discovers that the organization's product development team is proposing to collect government-issued identification (ID) numbers from customers to use as unique customer identifiers. Which of the following recommendations should be made to the product development team?
options: Customer identifiers should be a variant of the user's government-issued ID number
Customer identifiers should be a cryptographic hash of the user's government-issued ID number
Customer identifiers that do not resemble the user's government-issued ID number should be used
Customer identifiers should be a variant of the user's name, for example, 'jdoe' or 'john.doe'
questions.explanation: Government-issued ID numbers should not be used as identifiers due to privacy and security risks. Completely separate identifiers prevent exposure of sensitive personal information.

questions.question: The development team has been tasked with collecting data from biometric devices. The application will support a variety of collection data streams. During the testing phase, the team utilizes data from an old production database in a secure testing environment. What principle has the team taken into consideration?
options: Biometric data cannot be changed
The biometric devices are unknown
Biometric data must be protected from disclosure
Separate biometric data streams require increased security
questions.explanation: Biometric data is highly sensitive personal information that must be protected from disclosure. Using production data in testing demonstrates awareness of this protection requirement.

questions.question: Information security practitioners are in the midst of implementing a new firewall. Which of the following failure methods would BEST prioritize security in the event of failure?
options: Failover
Fail-Closed
Fail-Safe
Fail-Open
questions.explanation: Fail-closed means the firewall blocks all traffic when it fails, prioritizing security over availability by preventing potentially unauthorized access.

questions.question: Which of the following services can be deployed via a cloud service or on-premises to integrate with Identity as a Service (IDaaS) as the authoritative source of user identities?
options: Multi-factor authentication (MFA)
Directory
User database
Single sign-on (SSO)
questions.explanation: A directory service (like Active Directory or LDAP) serves as the authoritative source for user identities and can integrate with IDaaS for centralized identity management.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is TRUE about Secure Shell (SSH)?
options: SSH supports port forwarding, which can be used to protect less secured protocols
SSH does not protect against man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks
SSH is easy to deploy because it requires a Web browser only
SSH can be used with almost any application because it is concerned with maintaining a circuit
questions.explanation: SSH tunneling/port forwarding allows insecure protocols to be encrypted by tunneling them through SSH connections, providing security for otherwise unprotected communications.

questions.question: What is considered a compensating control for not having electrical surge protectors installed?
options: Having dual lines to network service providers built to the site
Having a hot disaster recovery (DR) environment for the site
Having network equipment in active-active clusters at the site
Having backup diesel generators installed to the site
questions.explanation: A hot DR site compensates for surge damage by providing immediate failover capability, ensuring business continuity even if the primary site is damaged by electrical issues.

questions.question: What is the FIRST step in risk management?
options: Identify the factors that have potential to impact business
Establish the scope and actions required
Identify existing controls in the environment
Establish the expectations of stakeholder involvement
questions.explanation: Risk management begins with identifying risk factors (threats, vulnerabilities, impacts) that could affect the business before scoping, control assessment, or stakeholder engagement.

questions.question: Which of the following is the PRIMARY goal of logical access controls?
options: Restrict access to an information asset
Ensure availability of an information asset
Restrict physical access to an information asset
Ensure integrity of an information asset
questions.explanation: The primary goal of logical access controls is to restrict who can access information assets in the digital realm, controlling authentication and authorization.

questions.question: Which of the following is a covert channel type?
options: Pipe
Memory
Storage
Monitoring
questions.explanation: Storage covert channels transmit information by modifying stored data (files, disk space, etc.), allowing unauthorized communication between processes or systems.

questions.question: A software developer wishes to write code that will execute safely and only as intended. Which of the following programming language types is MOST likely to achieve this goal?
options: Weakly typed
Dynamically typed
Strongly typed
Statically typed
questions.explanation: Strongly typed languages enforce strict type checking, reducing errors and unexpected behavior by preventing type mismatches and ensuring code executes as intended.

questions.question: Which of the following roles is responsible for ensuring that important datasets are developed, maintained, and are accessible within their defined specifications?
options: Data Custodian
Data Reviewer
Data User
Data Owner
questions.explanation: Data custodians are responsible for the technical maintenance, storage, and accessibility of data according to specifications set by data owners.

questions.question: What is static analysis intended to do when analyzing an executable file?
options: Search the documents and files associated with the executable file
Analyze the position of the file in the file system and the executable file's libraries
Collect evidence of the executable file's usage, including dates of creation and last use
Disassemble the file to gather information about the executable file's function
questions.explanation: Static analysis involves examining executable code without running it, typically through disassembly to understand functionality, identify vulnerabilities, or detect malicious behavior.

questions.question: A network security engineer needs to ensure that a security solution analyzes traffic for protocol manipulation and various sorts of common attacks. In addition, all Uniform Resource Locator (URL) traffic must be inspected and users prevented from browsing inappropriate websites. Which of the following solutions should be implemented to enable administrators the capability to analyze traffic, blacklist external sites, and log user traffic for later analysis?
options: Application-Level Proxy
Intrusion detection system (IDS)
Host-based Firewall
Circuit-Level Proxy
questions.explanation: Application-level proxies inspect traffic at the application layer, enabling deep packet inspection, URL filtering, content blocking, and detailed logging of user activities.

questions.question: What is the PRIMARY consideration when testing industrial control systems (ICS) for security weaknesses?
options: ICS often run on UNIX operating systems
ICS often do not have availability requirements
ICS are often sensitive to unexpected traffic
ICS are often isolated and difficult to access
questions.explanation: ICS are extremely sensitive to unexpected network traffic which can cause operational disruptions or safety issues. Testing must be carefully controlled to avoid impacting operations.

questions.question: The security team plans on using automated account reconciliation in the corporate user access review process. Which of the following must be implemented for the BEST results with fewest errors when running the audit?
options: Frequent audits
Segregation of Duties (SoD)
Removal of service accounts from review
Clear provisioning policies
questions.explanation: Clear provisioning policies provide the baseline against which automated reconciliation compares actual access, enabling accurate identification of discrepancies with minimal errors.

questions.question: In the common criteria, which of the following is a formal document that expresses an implementation-independent set of security requirements?
options: Organizational Security Policy
Security Target (ST)
Protection Profile (PP)
Target of Evaluation (TOE)
questions.explanation: A Protection Profile defines implementation-independent security requirements for a category of products, serving as a template that multiple products can claim conformance to.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a vulnerability of full-disk encryption (FDE)?
options: Data on the device cannot be restored from backup
Data on the device cannot be backed up
Data in transit has been compromised when the user has authenticated to the device
Data at rest has been compromised when the user has authenticated to the device
questions.explanation: Once a user authenticates to an FDE-protected device, the disk is decrypted and data at rest becomes accessible. If the device is compromised while unlocked, data is vulnerable.

questions.question: What is the FIRST step in reducing the exposure of a network to Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) based attacks?
options: Implement network access control lists (ACL)
Implement an intrusion prevention system (IPS)
Implement a web application firewall (WAF)
Implement egress filtering at the organization's network boundary
questions.explanation: Network ACLs provide the first line of defense by filtering ICMP traffic at network boundaries, blocking or limiting ICMP packets based on defined rules.

questions.question: A large organization's human resources and security teams are planning on implementing technology to eliminate manual user access reviews and improve compliance. Which of the following options is MOST likely to resolve the issues associated with user access?
options: Implement a Privileged Access Management (PAM) system
Implement a role-based access control (RBAC) system
Implement identity and access management (IAM) platform
Implement a single sign-on (SSO) platform
questions.explanation: IAM platforms provide comprehensive identity governance, automated access reviews, provisioning/deprovisioning workflows, and compliance reporting to address user access management at scale.

questions.question: A cloud service accepts Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) assertions from users to exchange authentication and authorization data between security domains. However, an attacker was able to spoof a registered account on the network and query the SAML provider. What is the MOST common attack leveraged against this flaw?
options: Attacker leverages SAML assertion to register an account on the security domain
Attacker forges requests to authenticate as a different user
Attacker exchanges authentication and authorization data between security domains
Attacker conducts denial-of-service (DoS) against the security domain by authenticating as the same user repeatedly
questions.explanation: SAML vulnerabilities commonly allow attackers to forge authentication requests to impersonate other users by manipulating SAML assertions or responses.

questions.question: An organization is implementing security review as part of system development. Which of the following is the BEST technique to follow?
options: Perform incremental assessments
Engage a third-party auditing firm
Review security architecture
Conduct penetration testing
questions.explanation: Incremental assessments throughout the development lifecycle identify and remediate security issues early, reducing costs and ensuring security is built into the system.

questions.question: What Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) response header can be used to disable the execution of inline JavaScript and the execution of eval()-type functions?
options: X-XSS-Protection
Content-Security-Policy
X-Frame-Options
Strict-Transport-Security
questions.explanation: Content-Security-Policy (CSP) header controls which scripts can execute, including blocking inline JavaScript and eval() functions, mitigating XSS attacks.

questions.question: A security professional was tasked with rebuilding a company's wireless infrastructure. Which of the following are the MOST important factors to consider while making a decision on which wireless spectrum to deploy?
options: Facility size, intermodulation, and direct satellite service
Performance, geographic location, and radio signal interference
Existing client devices, manufacturer reputation, and electrical interference
Hybrid frequency band, service set identifier (SSID), and interpolation
questions.explanation: Performance requirements, geographic/regulatory constraints, and radio interference are critical factors in selecting the appropriate wireless spectrum for deployment.

questions.question: A software development company has a short timeline in which to deliver a software product. The software development team decides to use open-source software libraries to reduce the development time. What concept should software developers consider when using open-source software libraries?
options: Open source libraries contain known vulnerabilities, and adversaries regularly exploit those vulnerabilities in the wild
Open source libraries can be used by everyone, and there is a common understanding that the vulnerabilities in these libraries will not be exploited
Open source libraries contain unknown vulnerabilities, so they should not be used
Open source libraries are constantly updated, making it unlikely that a vulnerability exists for an adversary to exploit
questions.explanation: Open-source libraries often have publicly disclosed vulnerabilities that attackers actively exploit. Developers must track and patch these vulnerabilities in their applications.

questions.question: A security engineer is assigned to work with the patch and vulnerability management group. The deployment of a new patch has been approved and needs to be applied. The research is complete, and the security engineer has provided recommendations. Where should the patch be applied FIRST?
options: Lower environment
Desktop environment
Server environment
Production environment
questions.explanation: Patches should first be applied in lower (development/test) environments to identify compatibility issues or unintended consequences before deploying to production.

questions.question: What BEST describes the confidentiality, integrity, availability triad?
options: A vulnerability assessment to see how well the organization's data is protected
The three-step approach to determine the risk level of an organization
The implementation of security systems to protect the organization's data
A tool used to assist in understanding how to protect the organization's data
questions.explanation: The CIA triad is a foundational model used as a tool to guide security professionals in understanding and implementing appropriate protections for organizational data.
